comments.body: Instead of declaring two subclasses that only function to pass different arguments to the constructor of their superclass, can we just inline these constructors and pass the desired different arguments at the call site?
We could. I prefer the current way because it seems easier to use.

I'm fine with either approach, but testing coverage wise:

1) If we want to keep a separate class, should we also add a `RocksDBTimestampedSegmentedBytesStoreTest`?

2) If we just want to maintain a single class, say under `RocksDBSegmentedBytesStore` as the current `AbstractRocksDBSegmentedBytesStore`, then should we augment the existing test file with timestamps enabled as well?
